definition: to piece together/to join together/to stake all/adventurous/at the risk of one's life/to spell

sentences.english: Avoid abbreviations, because people tend to spell out words in searches.
sentences.chinese: 避免使用缩写，人们在搜索时，一般会拼写出单词。

sentences.english: Real-word spell checking is a long-existing problem in the natural language processing field.
sentences.chinese: 真词错误拼写校对是自然语言处理领域中的一个难题。

sentences.english: Hardly does he make spelling mistakes.
If you do send a thank-you note, always check for spelling and grammar!
sentences.chinese: 如果你发送了一封感谢信，要记得检查拼写和语法。

sentences.english: Before delivering the job, run the spelling and grammar checker once more, just for safety's sake.
sentences.chinese: 在交活儿以前，仅为保险起见，须再运行一次拼写。

sentences.english: She spelled all the words into Helen's hand.
sentences.chinese: 她把所有单词拼写在海伦手上。

sentences.english: Is this spell check check not out mistakes, especially careful.
sentences.chinese: 这是拼写检查查不出的错误，要尤为小心。

sentences.english: Your bad spelling may prejudice your chances of getting the job.
sentences.chinese: 拼写拙劣会影响你获得这个职位。

sentences.english: I' m the best speller in our class.
sentences.chinese: 我是班上最好的拼写员。

sentences.english: The composition is very well written, saving that there are a few spelling mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 除了几个拼写错误外，这篇作文写得很好。

sentences.english: She then immediately spelled the word j-um-p for me.
sentences.chinese: 然后她立刻把“跳”的单词给我拼写出来。

sentences.english: The article is well written except that there are a few mis-spellings.
sentences.chinese: 你的文章写得不错，只是有几个拼写错误。

sentences.english: Phonetic phonology will take the standard of phoneme, while the writing the principle of conciseness.
sentences.chinese: 音系层面以音位划分为标准，拼写以简省为原则。

sentences.english: The metaphone() function can be used for spelling applications.
It's a pencil. 3. How do you spell pencil?
sentences.chinese: 运用猜测这一练习，复习字母和单词拼写。

sentences.english: Automatic spellchecking is not possible on text with markup.
sentences.chinese: 自动拼写检查无法处理带有标记的文字。

definition: pronunciation/literary (rather than colloquial) pronunciation of a Chinese character
Hanyu Pinyin, the romanization system used in the PRC since the 1960s
to pronounce a word after mentally processing its spelling/(phonics) blending
new word (in textbook)/word that is unfamiliar or not yet studied/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]
